text: Most zero - coupon CDs are in maturities of six to nine years , and they usually double in value by maturity . But investors who bought zero - coupon CDs in the secondary market are n't the only ones who may be surprised to learn the full amount of their investments is n't insured . People who paid a premium for standard CDs purchased on the secondary market could also find that those premiums are n't insured if the institutions that issued the CDs failed .
